result.execSummary:
The defendant John Kuznezow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Kuznezow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Kuznezow was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. W/huber, concur to 15cm933 & 15cm1299. Credit applies.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Remitted. $67 Victim Witness surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court authorized payment plan.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Rogans Shoes, JR, AB, or SR. Def not to possess alcohol.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample prev provided per DCSO.
